main.java.components.battery

Class Battery

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.AbstractCyPhyComponent
        • main.java.components.battery.Battery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.interfaces.CyPhyComponentI, BatteryImplementationI

    public class Battery
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.AbstractCyPhyComponent
implements BatteryImplementationI
    The class Battery implements the battery component. The battery can be in 3 differents states : SLEEP, DRAINING (produce energy) and RECHARCHING (consomes energy)
    Author:
    Bello Memmi

        public void start()
           throws fr.sorbonne_u.components.exceptions.ComponentStartException
        Description copied from interface: fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI
        start the component; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been initialised and the component calls in turn its own inner components. Implementations of this method must always return the control.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 post    isStarted()
